inn1.comm: what a leave! That didn't pitch too far outside off and swung in, Watson raised his bat out of the way to leave but that really didn't miss the off stump by much
this one goes the other way, squirting off the outer half of the bat down to third man, and Watto's away
seems a good pitch this, good carry through to the keeper. Nice wheels from Anderson too, as Paine raises his bat up and watches one go by outside off
dead on target, zoning in on off stump, and Paine is forward and right behind it to defend. Good pace again from Anderson
just too straight this time, and Paine works one off his pads down to fine leg
good ball to finish the over, full and straight. Watson defends, and that's a good, tight first over from Anderson
there's the Bresnan we got to know in Bangladesh this winter, bang on target on off stump straight away and giving the batsman nothing
spits off a length! Paine is struck on the glove and immediately pulls it off the bat. That must've hurt. Good ball on a length on off stump, just reared up at him
metronomic from Bresnan so far, on a length on off and defended
ah, Paine's lost his trust for this wicket. This was an identical ball to the last, on a length on off, but he didn't trust the bounce and defended awkwardly
a touch straighter, pushed to midwicket but no run
good finish, "nice tidy line and length" says Holding on commentary, and I concur
flashing drive from Watson, but it's well cut off by a diving Eoin Morgan at cover - he's saved runs there
on a length and slightly wide of off. Not wide enough for a cut, though, and Paine leaves well alone
identical ball to the last, and Paine reacts with a confident leave once again
shorter this time, and Paine swivels quickly into a pull. He went aerial but really didn't get a good connection on that, the ball lobs over midwicket though
on a length outside off, and Paine runs the ball of the face of the bat down to third man
fuller, wider, and left alone
first hint of width from Bresnan, and he's cut away towards point. The ball was hit very hard into the ground and bounced up and over the fielder there
fuller, and driven firmly into the covers

first boundary, and it's a good one! Bresnan fired one down full and straight and Paine presented the full face of the bat to drive down the ground. He hit the ball in the air, but firmly and dead straight, so not really any chance for the caught-and-bowled
Bresnan reverts to a better line and length, banging in a 'heavy ball' that jags up into the splice
and same again, he seems to have found his radar again
and again! Nice stuff from Bresnan, he's found a good length on this pitch and doesn't give any width either
on a length, and jammed down to third man off an open face
slightly shorter, Paine rises with the ball and sends it down to third man
fuller, Watto again looks for the one to third man but this time the ball goes to Pietersen at second slip. On the bounce.

smeared across the line to midwicket! The ball was full, just outside off and he just drilled it through midwicket. Luke Wright was close in at midwicket but he barely had a chance to stop that. Was it a chance? Well, it almost took his head off it was so hard
four more! Width from Anderson this time and Watson slashes up and over the slips and down to third man. Purposefully hit.
much better ball to finish, seaming in just a touch and full of length. Watson defends and the ball squirts off the inside edge to the leg side
short, not quite the bouncer but it got up to chest height. Paine plays the ball one-handed towards square leg and they set off for a quick single
easy, easy runs. Fine leg had just been brought up, Bresnan slipped one down towards leg stump and all he had to do was get bat on it.
Watto is struck in the midriff! The ball wasn't that short but he went for an almighty swipe to midwicket. The ball rushed on to him to beat the shot
half an appeal from England as Bresnan gets a fuller one to seam in a little and strike the pad. He appeared to get some bat on it though. Woud've hit the top of middle.
jammed down just behind point and they charge through for a tight single
tight finish, on a length and zoning in on off stump and Paine defends
tight lines, on off stump and defended
a touch of width given, and the ball is run down to third man without drama
full again, and defended

where has that come from? Paine moved across to off stump and played a flamboyant one-legged flick over midwicket. He nailed it, really confident shot - and so it should be, there's not a lot on offer for the quick bowlers in this wicket
punched defensively to the off side
short and wide outside off, Paine goes for a full-blooded cut but can't get anything on it as the ball scoots past the outside edge
well-played, he punched the ball square, just behind point, and picks up a couple as third man runs round
aggression from Australia's openers! Bresnan runs his fingers over a slower one that ends up as a half-volley on off stump. Watson picked it early and slammed him up and over mid on. Strong shot!
Watto's struck again! He was going for that swivel-pull, but again the ball wasn't quite there to be hit and he's struck in the stomach. Doesn't flinch though...
on a length but wide, Watson goes for the slash to third man but the ball flies past the bat - no connection
run down to third man, just the one

well, after such a solid start Bresnan is beginning to lose it here. He bangs one in short but it's misdirected down the leg side and Paine has no trouble pulling the ball down to fine leg. He rolled his wrists over the ball nicely, keeping it down and finding perfect placement
not a great start, Broad dishes up a juicy half-volley on leg stump and Watson flicks down to fine leg. The fielder is slight up in the circle there, so anything hit past him is runs
better, starting outside off and just tailing in a touch. Watson is nicely behind it to defend

sharp yorker from Broad, and England appeal for the lbw! Watson was struck on the toe, and then the bat as he jammed it down, but the umpire's not interested. That was mighty close, struck just outside off stump but that was hitting off.
good riposte from Watson, as he thrashes a full ball drifting in to the pads wide of mid on and down to the boundary

Watto falls! Oh, he is utterly disconsolate as he walks off. Broad fired down a bumper, Watson was quickly into the pull - but perhaps too quick on the shot. The ball struck the leading edge - or possibly even the back of the bat - and looped ever so gently back towards Broad, who tumbled over in taking a good caught-and-bowled
full on off stump, Ponting defends
just a touch of width outside off, and Paine sends the ball down to third man to give his captain the strike
good pace from Bresnan, but mis-directed down the leg side. Ponting tried to hit it, but nothing on it and that's a wide
on a length and straight, Ponting works him straight to midwicket off the back foot
slipping towards leg stump, Ponting shapes to leg glance but is struck on the pad. Going down the leg side, though, so no appeal

well, they need to get Ponting out early, but they're not going to get him like this. Attempted bouncer, but Ponting is back and across in a flash and pulls him down to fine leg for an easy boundary. The fielder was back on the rope, but is quite square
fuller, clipped to midwicket
punched out to point, no run
Broad starts it well, landing on a length and line on off stump, drawing nothing but careful defence
touch of in-drift here from Broad, very early for reverse-swing I'd have thought, met with the fullest of faces, from the fresh-faced Paine
another good straight ball meets another good straight bat, patted back to the bowler
touch shorter from Broad, allows Paine to swivel and pull carefully out to deep midwicket for  a single
Broad digs one in short, and it's fairly quick, Ponting tucks under it and rises to see the umpire calling it wide, much to Broad's annoyance
this is turning out to be a good over from Broad, on a length and line and Ponting nails a very solid defence
slightly slower ball, and fuller too, Ponting check-drives back to Broad, who fields in his follow though and throws the ball back past Ponting to the wicketkeeper
long spell from Bresnan here, his sixth over, jumps wide of the crease and angles it in, Paine defends

ooh! Pretty close, Paine tickled a fullish ball round the corner, and called for two, a touch of misunderstanding means Paine has to dive in as he completes the second, the throw from fine leg is a fraction wide so by the time Kieswetter has the bails off, Paine is safe
much quieter this delivery, just on off stump and defended back to the bowler
Paine looking to work Bresnan with the angle into the leg side, but Bresnan is mixing up his pace nicely, and Paine can't quite connect
much more width on this, lures Paine into having a bit of a slash outside off stump, gets the inside edge and squirts away for a single

Bresnan is probably lucky to get away with this, it was short, angling down the leg side, Ponting accepted the invitation to pull, but couldn't quite connect firmly and collected a scrappy single towards square leg
tidy start to the over here, fullish on off stump and Ponting strides out and defends
touch of drift into the legs and Ponting helps himself to a single out to deep midwicket
Broad, who has spent the last month in the gym, is trying to be aggressive here, fielding the ball and aiming a throw at Ponting at the non-strikers end
good tight bowling and Paine is happy to give nothing away, blocking away diligently
much shorter here, and quick too, zipping well past Paine who pulls out the way of the bouncer

dropped by Anderson, and what a catch it should have been! Paine tried to break the shackles, swiping across the line at Broad, but it was mistimed towards mid on where a diving Anderson got two hands to it but could not hold on
carefully defended this time by Paine

gone this time! The mistake doesn't cost England as Luke Wright strikes. It was a touch slower, outside off, Paine aimed a cut shot but it found the inside edge, went on to his boot and on to the stumps
oooh, almost added a third duck to his tour, this ghosted past the outside edge as Clarke hung his bat tentatively
much more solid this time, meeting a full straight bat with a broad straight bat and patting it back to the bowler
dug in a fraction shorter, and there was some width outside off, Clarke thought about a cut but opted to leave alone instead
Wright completes an excellent over with another ball bang on target, Clarke tried to work it into the leg side but couldn't connect
Ponting looks at ease among all the action, just turning this off his legs for a single to midwicket
good stuff from Broad, full and attacking the stumps with a touch of inswing, Clarke carefully pushes it away
Clarke yet to score but this is a well-played defensive shot, full-faced bat taps it back to the bowler
well, he's still on zero but only because Clarke couldn't reach it, very short and called a wide
off the mark now, pushed delicately to point where a quick single becomes comfortable thanks to a needless fumble
lovely shot, really top shot this, made it look so easy. Broad landed a slower ball a fraction wide outside off, Ponting got on his toes and caressed a back-foot drive through cover for four
fuller ball this time, Ponting tickles it for a single and that ends the bowling Powerplay
Ponting really strides into this forward defence, he's really bristling around the crease, busily patting down patches
little bit of width allows the batsman to open the face and guide this for a couple to third man
fuller and straighter from Wright, Ponting pushes it firmly to mid on
nicely bowled, Wright holding his nerve and landing it full on off stump, Ponting full-faces into the covers
once again it's carefully defended, pushed into the cover region
well, what was going to be a very good over has been undone in an instant. Ponting leant into a crisp drive, playing it on the up, to send it careering through the covers for four
good stuff from Broad once more, landing it on and around middle stump, just short of a length, Clarke defends
touch fuller from Broad, Clarke tucks it to mid on, and scampers a swift single
quicker from Broad and a touch short, Ponting swivelled on a pull shot, placing it carefully down to fine leg for a single
Clarke is pushing at the ball a fraction, which happens when you're out of nick, it means it comes off an inside edge flying into his unmentionables
more comfortable here from Clarke, working it round the corner for a single
neatly played, just short of a length, Ponting worked it gently in front of midwicket to collect a couple
Wright lands this down the leg side, thuds off Clarke's thigh for a single

How about that!? Ponting has gone! Really gifted his wicket away there, it was short and angling down the leg side, Ponting tried to help a routine pull shot on it's way, but got under the ball, sending it in the air towards fine leg, where Broad ran around to his right and slid to take an excellent catch with both hands. Massive breakthrough for England
White gets a good yorker first up, and defends it very comfortably
good ball this, aggressive stuff from Wright, banged in and reared up at White, who got in an awful position and it came off the shoulder of the bat
Wright really bounding in, finding decent pace and a decent line, Clarke defends
good ball to finish the over, he's bowled very well so far today, good length and good line, defended watchfully
starts well, looping it on off stump, White, who is enormous, defends
slung in of off stump again, White content to watch carefully and defend
just drifting on to middle stump, later in his innings White might have had a heave at, but here he blocks
this just grips and sticks in the wicket a fraction, draws a slightly false defensive shot from White
tidy stuff from Yardy, just restricting White, nothing fancy, on off stump and defended
maiden over! Good on Yardy, White treating him with utmost respect. For now.
neatly done from Clarke, just pushing a good-length delivery into a space at cover for one
tight stuff from Wright again, on off stump, the batsman happy to defend
Wright has such a happy run-up, really bounds in like a puppy, the ball is less adorable though, forcing White into a hurried defensive block
White content to play himself in, defending diligently on off stump
and that's why. Too short, plenty of time for White to roll his thunderous arms over the ball and send a pull shot running away for four down to square leg
Clarke hurries into a defensive block to cover
for some reason mid off is deep, allowing Clarke to milk a gentle single
White defends carefully again against Yardy
neatly played here, down on one knee and working a carefully sweep down to fine leg for a couple
another couple taken, just pushed into space easily enough
single taken into the leg side
left alone outside off stump to start

gone! Anderson changes ends and picks up a wicket, as White tries to force the ball through the covers off the back foot but gets an inside edge which cannons into his stumps! England continue to chip away at the Australian batting line-up, and a great deal now rests on Clarke and Hussey
is that a touch of reverse swing from Anderson? Surely too early for it, but this ball snaked away from Hussey sharply, and late too! Defended though.
tapped defensively into the covers
good lines, starting on leg stump and just tucking Hussey up a touch as he shapes to clip to midwicket
fuller this time, and Hussey dead-bats it back down the wicket with the straightest of bats. Wicket maiden for Anderson!
Clarke shuffles across to off and bunts down to long-on for one
Hussey rocks quickly onto the back foot to force down to long on, and he's off the mark
twinkle-toed use of the feet from Clarke, as he comes down the track and clips through midwicket
nice placement from Hussey, as he sends the ball down towards third man. Picks up two, he didn't try to hit it too hard, just getting it past the man there
easily worked down to long-off
quicker one speared in to Clarke's pads, and he works the ball out to deep midwicket
punch-drive. Firmly hit, but straight to mid off.
slapped square, the point fielder leaps extravagantly to his left to try and cut it off, but they pick up a couple as third man sprints round
Anderson straightens his line, Clarke gets nicely back and across and defends back down the wicket
tip-and-run from the batsmen, as Clarke drops the ball close in on the off side and they set off
Anderson has kept things very tight to Hussey so far, and this ball is no exception. Full and aimed at the stumps, and Mr. Cricket defends
angling across the left-hander, who taps the ball towards point and looks for the single. No runs on offer though, as the fielder charges in
nice and straight to start, Clarke punches to mid on, where Pietersen fluffs a simple stop and they take a single as a result
hmm, a few little fielding errors creeping in here. Hussey drives straight to Anderson in the covers, the ball slips under his hands and they take another single from a misfield
on a length, punched just to mid-off's left and the call for a single comes straight away. Good running, no hesitation at all.
Hussey tries to clip to midwicket, but the ball takes the inside edge, bobbles off the pad and lands at his feet. He thinks about the cheeky single, but the England fielders quickly converge
sliced down to third man for one
driven hard along the ground to mid-off's right, where the fielder makes a good, tumbling stop. No run
tapped between point and short third man and they set off for a sharp single
Clarke comes down the track but can't get to the pitch, so instead thrusts his pad and bat out at the ball. Big turn from Swann, and bounce
again he uses his feet, but can't get a good connection

stays deep in the crease this time, Swann slips just a little short and he's carved away behind point for four. Intelligent batting from Clarke there, he had come down two balls in a row and then stayed right back
four more, off the edge of the bat this time. Clarke went to drive down the ground but the ball went on with the arm, taking a thick edge and running down to third man
punched into the leg side
angling across Hussey from over the wicket, and the ball is easily worked down to third man
back of a length, on or around off stump, and Clarke goes back and across to defend with a straight bat
short, and wide of off but Clarke follows through with the pull. The ball was far too wide for the shot though, and it goes absolutely nowhere, trickling to mid on
classical shot! Wonderfully driven on the up through the covers by Clarke, all along the turf. What's more, Wright has over-stepped and that's a no-ball
short, and pulled off the toe of the bat to deep midwicket
short, and rearing up into Hussey's ribs. He rode the bounce admirably, however, dropping the ball on the leg side and Clarke immediately calls him through for one
driven on the walk by Clarke, who gets a good connection but can't quite beat a tumbling mid off
Clarke dances down the track, Swann sees him coming and pulls the length back and he's defended
down the track again, gets to the pitch this time and drives him out to cover
Hussey opens the face as he looks for space square on the off side, no run though as it went straight to the fielder at backward point
punched down to long off
much too short from Swann, but the damage is minimal as Clarke slaps him hard off the back foot but straight out to the cover sweeper
full, driven off the front foot through the covers and out to the boundary fielder
Hussey is hurried as the ball spits up at him off a length, but rides the bounce well and opens the face to pick up one to third man
driven straight to mid on

and, just as that comment comes through, Wright slips short and is pulled away to the square leg boundary by Clarke. There are two men out there, but he found great placement with a well-controlled pull
much fuller this time, Clarke comes down the track and drives on the walk back to Wright, who picks the ball up and sends the batsman scrambling back to his crease
confident shot! Very full again and Clarke swings through the line and nails a superb straight drive down the ground. Aesthetically pleasing, to say the least.
full again, but not quite there for the drive and Clarke defends out into the covers
just too full from Swann, Hussey drives out through the covers and the sweeper on the boundary has to run to his left to cut it off, allowing them to get back for two
much better length, and Hussey defends off the front foot
again, floated up nicely and on the right length, Hussey stretches forward to smother the spin
tapped gently into the covers between the fielders, and they sprint through for a sharp single
Clarke comes down the track as Swann fires one wide, but he gets his bat and pad nicely together and across to keep the ball out
defends off the front foot with the full face of the bat
driven hard out square on the off side by Hussey, but there's a boundary fielder to cut it off
just a touch short from Yardy, and Clarke stays deep in the crease, punching down to long on for one to bring up the fifty partnership
dragged down short again, Hussey is quickly back into a powerful pull, but straight out to the fielder
tapped into the covers, a touch of hesitation in the running! The throw comes in, fairly softly it must be said, and they appeal for the run out but he was easily in.
Hussey looks to chop the ball down to third man but he's cramped for room and can't get it away
width given this time, and Hussey slashes him down behind square for a couple
Swann flights one to Clarke, who happily punches it out to long on for a single
nicely done from Swann, just went on with the arm from outside off stump, Hussey tried to cut but couldn't get much of it
this time it's neatly turned into the leg side for a single
middle-over-milking mode from Clarke, picking a gap to long on and collecting one
another single, brings up the 50 stand, strokes through cover for one
Clarke skips up the wicket, meets it on the half-volley and send it to long on for a single
neatly done again by Clarke, walking up the wicket and clipping a single to long on
touch too leg-sided from Yardy, Hussey eagerly clips off his legs for one square of the wicket
touch shorter, allows Clarke to stand tall and push down the wicket to long on
dot ball, rare dot at the moment, touch short, Hussey pulled but straight to midwicket
good ball this, full and straight and Hussey happy to defend
another dot to end the over, fullish, Hussey works it into the leg side but straight to midwicket
nicely bowled by Swann, just held back a fraction, Clarke skips forward and defends
once again Clarke is dancing down the track, so comfortable, and working a single to long on
this time Hussey earns a couple, stroking a square drive out to the point boundary
back to single mode, these two are playing very well, clipped off the legs into midwicket region
pushed down the ground once again from Clarke

ovely bowling this, and if there was a slip this would have been out, looped up outside off, spinning away, Hussey drives, it comes off the edge and Morgan has to run down to the third man boundary, and slides well to keep it to three

the ball change, the drinks, and Michael Yardy have done the trick! Hussey has gone! Really nothing dismissal that, outside off, skidded on a touch with the newer ball perhaps, got a faint outside edge, and Hussey walked
starts well enough, blocking out a darting yorker
oh dear, mid off back to the new batsman, how very needless, Hopes doesn't mind, he pushes to long on for a easy single
oops, darted well down the leg side from Yardy and he'll have to bowl another
Clarke trying to give himself room to squeeze out a cut shot, but can't collect one
single here though, repeating the shot, connecting well enough for a single to cover
Swann landing it on a decent line and length and Hopes blocks
more good stuff from Swann, Hopes happy to dig in for a while
bit of spin here, from well outside off, and Hopes can't squeeze any sort of shot out
single this time, full and pushed into the covers for one
Clarke can't get one here, defending carefully off the front foot
good end to a good over, Clarke blocking away diligently
good again, darting it into the batsman, who can do nothing but defend
very nicely done again from Yardy, building pressure
nothing for the batsman to latch on to, very accurate stuff
quietly blocked once again
still nothing for Hopes, all defence
neatly blocked to finish a maiden over
Clarke collects a single straight away, skipping down the wicket and pushing to long on
Hopes gets into the swing of things now, milking a single down the ground
Clarke is doing this very well, working the ball around with ease
Hopes gets a touch of width and cuts past a diving point for a couple
now he helps himself to a single, pushing down the ground
Clarke brings up a very useful fifty. He was struggling for runs this tour, started slowly but has played the spinners superbly today
Clarke continues his merry single taking, chipping down the crease and clipping a single down to long on
Hopes follows the example set by his vice-captain, and dabs a single to midwicket
nothing for Clarke here, too quick from Yardy, hurries the shot
more good stuff from Yardy, Clarke given nothing to work with
good ball, quicker, flatter, Clarke defends
touch of extra bounce, Clarke dabs to short third man
good stuff from Swann, changing his pace nicely, Hopes can't set himself so blocks
defended once again, almost some pressure building here
ah, that will do nicely. Really top shot this, Hopes comes down the wicket and chips very carefully, and times it nicely, into a gap at cow corner for a welcome boundary
defended carefully
clipped away for a single
good from Clarke, picking a gap and collecting a couple
Yardy really darting them in, difficult to get away but Hopes manages to squeeze out a single
touch of width and Clarke takes full toll, skipping leg side of the ball and cutting well behind point for four
ooh, almost repeated the shot, but it skidded on a fraction and past the edge of Clarke's cut
this time Clarke goes leg side, flicking round the corner for two
back to milking mode here, edging down the wicket and pushing down the ground for a single
Hopes bunts a single down the ground to finish the over
good start - not traditional death bowling, back of a length, but nice and straight and there's nothing Hopes can do with that
errs in line this time, too much width and he's cut away very hard towards the point boundary. A superb sliding stop from Anderson cuts the ball off though
back of a length again, Hopes can't seem to get it away when it's straight
a touch shorter this time, Hopes aims a meaty pull out to deep midwicket where Morgan fields not quite cleanly, but they decide against what would have been a risky two
too straight this time, and he's clipped down to fine leg
short again, Hopes has his eye in now and he's slapped this very hard in front of square on the leg side! The bowling plan backfired a bit there... taking nothing away from a top shot from Hopes
good start, Clarke skips down the track and Yardy spears one at his toes, almost yorking him
chopped out to deep cover off the back foot
floaty - for Yardy - and he's driven down to long on
punched down on the other side of the wicket this time, Yardy dives across but can't cut it off and they take one to long-off
clipped straight to midwicket in the circle
stylishly driven down to long off to end Yardy's spell, and well-bowled!
full, fast and straight, Hopes stays leg side of the ball and drives down to long off
full toss on off stump, Clarke drives him out to the cover sweeper. He could have hit that anywhere, it was a strangely passive shot
Clarke backs away to leg as Bresnan digs one in short. The ball is dropped softly into the covers, and they're across for a sharp single
in the blockhole, Hopes jams the bat down on the ball to send it on to the leg side, but Morgan scoots across from midwicket to cut it off

going for the yorker again, but this one has slipped out as a half-volley on leg stump and he's firmly clipped wide of midwicket. Good running fetches them three as Wright sprints round to cut the ball off
punched down to long on, and that brings up the fifty partnership between these two, which is good news for Australia - they haven't let the loss of Hussey slow their momentum too much
yorker first up, hit hard into the ground and it bounces up and over Anderson - a single taken

Hopes charges down the track and gives himself room as Anderson spears in another yorker. Good, intelligent batting from the allrounder, he doesn't look to welly it but just opens the face of the blade to place the ball between point and short third man. Top shot!
nudged out to deep midwicket

gone! Slower-ball bouncer from Anderson, rolling his fingers over the off-cutter. Hopes backed away and tried to uppercut to third man, but the ball was so slow that he couldn't get any elevation or distance on it, and Bresnan takes an easy catch at short third man. A wicket at just the right time for the hosts!
Hauritz is off the mark first ball as he tucks the ball easily into the acres of space on the leg side
offcutter again from Anderson, this one was fuller though - on a length on off stump - and Clarke just pushed it softly back to the bowler
driven to a deep-ish mid off
back of a length, Hauritz chops the ball down behind square and they take one as third man runs in

slow off cutter from Broad, landing on a length outside off, Clarke comes down the track, giving himself some room as he does, and lifts the ball up and over the off side field. He didn't time it perfectly, but well enough to find the boundary
slow cutter again, Clarke stays back and pulls out to deep midwicket
bouncer to the lower-order batsman, and this time it's a quick one! He flings the bat out at it, and they take one as the ball trickles into the leg side
driven down to long on to keep the strike
backs away, Anderson flings down an inch-perfect yorker which he jams the bat down on. The ball goes nowhere, but Hauritz immediately charges through, racing Anderson to the other end and winning
punched to cover, they set off immediately for the single
full again, but wide of off, and the ball is jammed out behind square on the off side

sharp bouncer, and Hauritz wasn't expecting that! Really well-directed, nasty short ball, Hauritz took his eyes off it and is struck on the glove. The ball goes in to space down to third man and they take one
full, straight and drilled down to long on
slower bouncer to Hauritz this time, he seemed to pick it, waiting on the pull shot, but couldn't connect with the ball as it looped past his grille
waist-high full toss, Clarke tries to paddle him to fine leg but straight to the fielder. Touch and go for the high no-ball
bouncer from Broad, not all that sharp but it's good enough to beat Hauritz's swipe as he backs away to leg and aims to flay over off
back of a length again, Hauritz backs away and drops the ball into the covers, they take a sharp single
slow cutter, just short of a length, and it's flat-batted down to long on
well, Hauritz is finally coming to terms with this short-pitched attack. Another bumper, he backs to leg, setting himself, and lifts the ball up and over the keeper and away to third man

and again, mirror image to the last shot! A somewhat predictable bouncer from Broad, this time Hauritz didn't back away and just helped the ball very fine on the leg side. Four more valuable runs for Australia
full toss on leg stump, lifted out to deep midwicket but bouncing well short of any fielders
another full toss on leg stump, clipped along the ground this time but out to midwicket again
Clarke backs away but Anderson follows him with a slower cutter, just one run as Clarke slams him down to long on
full and wide of off, Hauritz tries to drive through the covers but can't quite time it, the cover fielder cutting it off and just one run taken
pinpoint yorker, Clarke jams his bat down to send the ball into the leg side and they take another one

comical stuff, Hauritz shuffles right across to off and sets himself for the scoop over the keeper. The ball was well wide of off though, he re-adjusted but knocked himself off his feet as he does so. Recovered in time to complete the single and keep the strike though
full toss on middle, slapped down to long on
on a length outside off, punched down to long on where some sluggish fielding allows them to charge back for the second!
backs away to leg and Broad follows him with a full ball. The ball takes the edge, cannons off the boot and loops to the off side. Clarke is disappointed he couldn't make more of that

another paddle-scoop from Hauritz, and this time he pulls it off excellently! He never took his eyes off the ball as Broad fired one down wide of off, getting a good connection to lift the ball up and over the field
gone this time! Full toss on leg stump, and it's softly tapped straight to Strauss at mid off. He didn't even have to move! Still, Hauritz has done a good job

just a single to finish as Clarke goes across to the off side, tries to flick to leg but gets another edge on to the pad which goes towards third man. Clarke is disappointed not to have capitalised once again, swinging his bat in anger.

inn2.comm: starts with an energetic but misdirected ball, down the leg side, which Strauss can't quite tickle away
ooop, Bollinger has got this all wrong. Quickish yes, but miles down the leg side
this is the Strauss brand of 'Power Hitting', clipping a full half-volley on leg stump through midwicket for four. All along the ground
and again! Strauss flying, nothing more than a gentle push through midwicket for another boundary, not a particularly great ball that
Bollinger bustling in, and gets this one right, just outside off stump, Strauss leaves it alone
ooh, first real test for Strauss, full and straight, drifting in a touch and rapping Strauss on the pads, would have uprooted middle but there was a faint inside edge
ooh, play and a miss from Strauss to finish the over. Short and wide, Strauss, for once, misses a cut
Harris straight into his stride, landing this in at 89mph, defended carefully for a single
too short and pushed across Strauss, perhaps the batsman should have cut because the pull shot was mistimed to mid on
swift bowling this, banged in short and wide, Strauss does cut this time, playing it nicely to third man
good ball here, on a length and line, Kieswetter meets it with a very straight bat and defends
touch shorter here, but good line again, Kieswetter stands up on his toes and defends
good second half to the over that, bang on a line and length and Kieswetter once again, can only defend
much better start from Bollinger to this over, fuller and straighter and Strauss pats it to mid on
nudged neatly into the midwicket region for a gentle single, not much movement off the pitch or in the air here
looks like an Australian plan not to go full to Kieswetter, everything has been back of a length, and once again it's defended
touch of width here, and it does not matter what length you bowl if there's width, Kieswetter stands tall and crisply punches through the covers for four
well, interesting leave that. Kieswetter staying leg side of the ball, showing all three stumps, and the ball bounces over middle
another leave, very diligent from the young man

gone! Harris strikes! Strauss's adventure ends. Full and inviting a drive, Strauss swishes hard, but the angle takes it across him and he can only manage a faint edge through to Paine. Big wicket that.
plenty of chat from the Aussie fielders, and why not, Pietersen though, defends very comfortably
ah, the full and straight attack at Pietersen, haven't really seen that since Steyn in South Africa, Pietersen digs out the yorker
good stuff from Harris, giving nothing away early, and Pietersen is forced into a hurried defence
good again from Harris, full and on off stump, Pietersen defends
beaten! Holding that off-stump line, Pietersen pushes a touch aimlessly at it, there was a faint faint sound, but nothing given. Plenty of chat from Australia, plenty
dug in short first up, Kieswetter leaps to cut it away nicely down to third man

well, another one! Australia really sizzling now! It was down the leg side, massive appeal as Pietersen missed his leg-side nudge, this time there was no doubt in the decision but still there is plenty of noise from both the crowd and the fielders
finally a calm single for Pietersen, pushed to mid off. Bollinger strained over the line, which means the next ball will be Free Hit time
comical stuff this, Kieswetter ran miles outside leg stump, Bollinger pushed it across outside off stump, and somehow the batsman managed to reach for it and squirt it through for four to third man
oh dear, horrid shot this. Kieswetter giving himself room again, before swishing hopelessly at it
after all that excitement Kieswetter opts for a classic leave outside off stump
another orthodox shot to finish the over, calmly defending a length ball on off stump
lovely shot this time from Pietersen. Very simple, just leaning forward into a punched check-drive back past the bowler for four
fuller and angling down the leg side, Pietersen clips it firmly to midwicket and Harris has a massive lbw appeal, oddly
this time it's outside off stump and Pietersen leaves it well alone
Pietersen skips down the wicket, looking for a flamingo-clip through midwicket, but misses and it raps him on the pads
no fuss here, simple cricket, good ball just outside off stump, left alone
Pietersen just going at the ball a little hard here, full and outside off and driven off the inside edge to mid on
good stuff from Bollinger, nothing for Kieswetter to work with, so the batsman defends
Kieswetter looking for his favourite inside-out shot over cover, but he skips so far leg side of the ball that he can't reach it
this time Kieswetter plays from the crease and guides it to third man
neatly done, Pietersen takes a big stride to a length ball, pushes it to mid off and takes a single
lovely timing, really nicely done. Full and pushed across Kieswetter who leant forward and punched it through cover for four
single to finish the over, dabbed into the cover region
Ryan Harris is full of chat, must be because he's bowling quite nicely, forcing a defence from Kieswetter
good ball again, on a length and line and blocked
give Kieswetter width and you will be punished. Short and wide outside off and Kieswetter threw everything at it, flashing it hard through point for four
touch straighter this time, means Kieswetter can't flash it away, instead it's guided to third man
good running from Pietersen, happy to play second-fiddle for a while, pushing to mid on and scampering one
very correct forward defence to finish the over
starts with a nervy full toss outside off stump and Pietersen climbed into an off-drive between cover and mid off for four
better ball this time, on a length, but the line is wrong and Pietersen tickles it round the corner for a single
that's his best ball yet, fullish, on off stump and met with a careful forward defence
settling down now, decent pace, not express or anything, on middle and clipped to midwicket
ooh, inch-perfect leave, Kieswetter would argue, but it was very close to off stump
ooh, almost a first ODI wicket for Hazlewood, Kieswetter skipped down the wicket and aimed a big drive down the ground, didn't quite time it, but got enough on it to clear mid off
more good, pacey stuff from Harris, fullish and Pietersen prodded it to mid on
similar ball, similar shot, full, angling in, Pietersen aims a drive but it skews off the inside edge to mid on
touch shorter this time, Pietersen tried to whip it away but it thudded into his hip and trickled away for a single to bring up the 50
good from Harris, angling into Kieswetter, not giving any space to free his arms
another good ball, carefully defended once more
very good over that from Harris, full and straight and pushed to mid on to finish the over and the mandatory Powerplay
very good from Hazlewood, on a length and line and Pietersen defends
Pietersen skips down the wicket, trying to unsettle the youngster, but misses his attempted flick and it comes off his pads. An inexplicable overthrow allows one
shorter this time, Kieswetter looks a touch unsure of the shot as he pulls down to deep square for one
close again! Pietersen living dangerously here, big outside edge flies wide of first slip and down to the boundary for four
Pietersen down the wicket again, this time nudging away for a single
much shorter to finish up, Kieswetter aims a pull straight to mid on
slammed to mid off, no run
back of a length on middle, KP stays back and swipes him through midwicket. There's a man out there though
dropped softly into the covers, they set off immediately for what is ultimately a well-judged single
chopped down behind square on the offside, Ponting charges round and makes a good diving stop, picking the ball up cleanly to send the batsmen scampering back to their creases
imperious! Harmless ball from Watson, and Pietersen just stood at the crease and thumped him through the covers
misfield now! Punched straight to mid-off, who over-runs the ball and allows the batsmen an easy single
KP comes down the track, moving across to off as well in trying to open up the leg side, but he couldn't quite get to the ball and ends up pushing it softly to mid on
back of a length outside off, KP stays deep in the crease and forces off the back foot but straight to cover
not all that short, but Pietersen sways back and pulls behind square. Didn't get all of that, and the fielder on the rope scoots round to cut it off

overthrows, and that's woken the crowd up! Hazelwood sent down a slow cutter just outside off, which was tapped into space in the covers. The batsmen set off, the bowler collected the ball and tried to throw down the stumps, but the throw was wide and the crowd cheered as the overthrows were run!
pushed defensively towards point
Kieswetter comes down to play the flyswatter, shuffling to leg and looking to go inside-out through the covers, but slams the ball straight to the man at extra cover
wobbling in just a touch through the air, Pietersen clips to midwicket
punched down to long off - who has just been moved back. Watto leapt athletically across in his follow-through to try and cut it off, but couldn't quite get down in time
chipped over mid on! Well-struck, but only just cleared Bollinger. Watto has hands on head
and he follows that up with a single, worked to leg

gone! A wicket appears from nowhere, Watto had just dished up a fairly gentle ball quite wide of off, KP drove on the up and sliced it to Ponting at backward point, who tumbled forward and held on to a good catch. Just the wicket that Australia needed, England were rumbling along quite nicely until now.
back of a length, just outside off, and Collingwood punches to extra cover
nudged straight to mid on
Kieswetter looks to open the face and run the ball down behind square, but Ponting is round in a flash to cut it off
full, Kieswetter launches into a drive but perhaps goes too hard at it, the bottom hand comes through and the ball goes to leg rather than through the covers
Hazelwood finds some extra bounce from his height! It was pitched back of a length and spat up at Kieswetter, who lost sight of it but kept his cool and played it down

hooked! Bouncer from Hazelwood and Kieswetter swivelled on his back leg, hooking it from in front of his grille and getting enough on the shot to send the ball well over the boundary! Not out the middle, but six runs
and he goes fuller, Kieswetter driving to mid off
a bit of a nothing ball, around off stump but doing nothing in the air or off the pitch. Collingwood taps it gently to cover
attempted nurdle, he can't quite get it away though
fuller this time, just outside off, and some intent shown by Collingwood, who drives hard but straight to cover
shuffles down the track and aims a bottom-handed swipe to leg, but straight to mid on
driven on the other side of the wicket this time, but again picks out the fielder

beaten! It was more the perfect line and length than any movement by the ball, though, as Watto sent one down in the channel on off stump and Collingwood played inside it. Very close to the edge - and not far from off stump - but no harm done

gone! First international wicket for Australia's youngest ever ODI debutant! The ball pitched on a length on off stump, perhaps coming in a touch off the seam, and beat a loose defensive stroke from Kieswetter who played footed to the crease. It may have kept just a touch low, but nipped between bat and pad rather than under. Australia are right back in this!
Morgan off the mark straight away, running one off the outer half of the bat down to third man
fuller, and quite wide. Collingwood drives, somewhat leaden-footed, and the ball rolls slowly to mid off
back of a length outside off, pushed into the covers
Collingwood still not off the mark, pushing the ball into the covers once again
slips one in to his pads, and he's off the mark now in fitting style, nurdling one out to midwicket
on a length, an inch or two outside off, and Collingwood punches into the covers
pushed out through the covers this time, finding the gap to pick up a single
aimed at the leg stump from over the wicket, Morgan can't get any bat on it but the ball runs off the pad to fine leg and they pick up a leg bye
pushed out to deep cover off the back foot
Watto tries something different, banging one in halfway down, and Collingwood just pushes his weight back and pulls down to fine leg, where the fielder slides but can't cut it off
driven into the covers off the front foot. Well-hit, but he can't quite pierce the gap
back of a length, angling across Collingwood who pushes it to leg
similar ball, this time he tries to go through the off side but the ball comes off the inside edge onto the pad. Morgan calls him through for a sharp single
pacy, back of a length outside off, and Morgan gets on top of the ball to run it down to third man
Bollinger charges in and sends down a well-directed bouncer! That was pretty sharp, but Collingwood buckled his knees to get underneath it in good time
dropped defensively towards cover
what a finish! That ball has cut him clean in half! Collingwood shuffled slightly to off but Bollinger held his line on off stump and the ball shot between bat and body and over the stumps
full and angled very wide across Morgan from over the wicket. The batsman slashes hard at the ball, but one run to third man is the result
driven square, just in front of point, and the cover sweeper runs round and fires in the return throw to Paine

well, no great pace or danger from the ball, but Morgan just pulls his bat out of the way and watches it go past him. He's taking his time to play himself in, which is the right thing to do in the situation - what England need is a partnership
Watto holds this one cross-seam, and it just seams away a touch after pitching. Pushed softly to cover
slipping on to the pads, and he's worked away to fine leg

gone! Another wicket falls, and Watto is mobbed by his ebullient team-mates! Collingwood had charged down the track and tried to lift the ball over mid-off, but couldn't quite get to it and the ball lobbed off the toe of the bat straight to Hopes at mid off. It was another cross-seam delivery from Watson - perhaps it just held up a touch
that's just the sort of start he would've been hoping for - just a gentle full toss outside off stump and he crunches it out to cover. Quick running fetches him three
scythed straight to point
back of a length, outside off, and Morgan raises his bat out of the way to leave
driven between mid off and cover, placed just between them so the single was always on, even though he didn't hit it particularly well
again, Bollinger has cut through the right-hander's defences! Pitching middle and leg, and nipping between bat and pad and just over the stumps
slightly wider this time, and Wright is quite happy to leave well alone
decent start from Hopes, lolling it up on off stump, Morgan can't time it and it trickles to mid on
plenty of width here for Morgan, cuts carefully but a diving stop at backward point keeps it to a single
bit of a gentle ball this, shoved down the leg side, clips the pads and runs away fine for a couple
Wright hasn't had a chance to build an innings for England in a long time, so he should give himself time here, and plays this defensively
left alone outside off
this time it's nudged into the leg side to pick up a comfortable single
starts well outside off, looking for some spin back, Wright cuts but can't time it
ooh, this drifts a long way, and drags Wright across his stumps
defended again, good bowling this from Hauritz
beaten! Really top stuff, slow and looped outside off stump, Wright swishes and misses
ooh, very close this time, edge found as Wright aims a booming drive, but it goes down and through the slips for a couple
neat sweep shot this, delicately helped round the corner for a single
this is a nicer shot from Wright, full face of the bat and driven to mid off
much wider this time from Hopes, Wright happily cuts for a single out to deep point
swish and a miss from Morgan now, it was outside off, and Morgan slashed but could not connect
this time Morgan skipped down the wicket, aimed a cover drive which came off the outer-half of the edge down to third man
another big heave from Wright, not connecting very often at the moment
better shot, held his shape nicely, leaning into a cover drive for a single
more good stuff from Hauritz, looping it well outside off, Wright drives but straight to cover
this time Wright sweeps, and plays it nicely, guiding it down to deep square for one
Morgan is down on one knee straight away to Hauritz, dinking a sweep away for a couple
nicely bowled, really well bowled, held back, inviting a drive, Morgan defends
Ponting has taken the midwicket out, inviting Morgan to play against the spin, as it is he misses an attempted nudge
good bowling and not badly played either, Morgan skips down the wicket and jabs to mid on for a single
boundary, and England really needed that, touch of width from Hopes and Morgan nailed a cut shot to deep point for four
better line this time, no room, and Morgan has to defend
Hopes lucky to get away with this, it was shoved down the leg side, but Morgan couldn't connect with his sweep shot very cleanly
good from Wright, opening the face and guiding a single to deep point
bang! It was almost a chance, nut really it was past Hopes in a flash. Morgan bashed it down the ground for a boundary
this time it's carefully defended to finish the over
finds some extra bounce, and Wright squeezes out a cut shot down to third man for a single
short, and Morgan couldn't quite time the pull shot, instead sending it gently down to deep midwicket for a single
well, Wright keeps missing these, it's short and wide, really inviting the sort of slash Wright played, but he just seems to keep missing them
Hazlewood trying to repeat the line, but goes a little too far outside off and Wright leaves it alone
this is interesting, Australia have set the field for wide bowling outside off, serving Wright's favoured slash, and again he can't time it
well, they gave Wright enough practice, this time the short wide ball - a plan by the looks of things - has been crashed for four through point
better ball this, closer to the stumps, Wright stands tall and defends
oops, arrowed down the leg side, possibly trying to second guess Morgan
repeat delivery, but this time Morgan got a pad slightly in the way of it, annoyingly for him because it would have been another wide
nicely done from Wright, good cricket that, just gently pushed a off-stump ball to point for a swift single
ooh, sharp single this, Morgan dinked it round the corner and Wright called him through for a single, the throw almost beat Morgan at the non-strikers end
big turn here, surprises Wright as he tried to leave it
big sweep attempted, luckily for Wright he didn't time it and it went one-bounce to square leg
and the final ball, after all that fuss, is cut towards deep cover for one
slightly leg-sided here, Morgan can't time his clip away well and it thuds off via the pads for one
good ball here, just outside off stump and left alone from Wright
floated up a bit from Hazlewood and well outside off, Wright really nailed an off-side bash, but straight to deep point
lovely shot this, really top shot, made it look so simple, Morgan just chipped a leg-stump ball, through to the wide long on boundary, really timed it well
good response from Hazlewood, just outside off and Morgan defends
good running here, dropped into the off side and the batsman set off straight away for a quick single
too short from Hauritz, and Morgan made him pay. It wasn't all that short but Morgan was back in a flash, pulling in front of square to the deep midwicket boundary
this time it's a better length and line and dropped into the offside for a single
well outside off, spinning back a fraction and Wright leaves it alone
this time Wright is on the paddle-sweep and playing it well, collecting a single to deep square
Morgan leans forward and blocks, calm as you like
got this, really Morgan nailed this shot. Big wristy reverse-sweep, played perfectly, and races to the boundary
short first up, Wright rocks back to pull in the air but past a diving midwicket fielder
driven straight to point
sharp bouncer from Harris - ah, a little too sharp, as that's bounced way up and over Wright and he's called for a wide
back of a length again, wide of off this time and Wright runs it down just wide of third man, who runs round
fuller this time, on off stump and Wright stands at the crease to defend
half-volley wide of off and Wright has absolutely murdered this ... but out to the cover sweeper
squirts off the inside edge behind square on the leg side, they scamper through for one and consider a second, but wisely decide against it
on the mark straight away, on off stump and Morgan defends back down the wicket

ooh, dangerous shot from Morgan! He was given absolutely no room outside off but tried to run it down to third man. Luckily, the ball jammed down off the inside edge, otherwise that would have hit the timber
monstrous! Wright shuffled down the track and lifted Watto way, way over long on. It wasn't a slog, he just lifted the ball and went right through with the shot. England are cruising now!
shorter this time, and pulled but straight to midwicket
looks to run it to third man, but finds backward point
full and straight, Wright pushes the ball into the leg side and they sneak a single
nudged to fine leg, quick single
flung down on off stump, Morgan comes forward to drive into the covers
again cramping Morgan for room as he pushes his weight back and taps the ball back down the wicket
very full on off stump and the ball shoots off the outside edge of the bat to short third man. He was lucky to get something on that, it would have uprooted off stump
a touch short, Wright rides the bounce well but sends the ball straight to the backward point fielder
full and swinging in to the pads a little, Wright shuffles across and clips firmly out to deep midwicket

short and Morgan hammers a swivel-pull up and over midwicket! Authoritative stroke, and he was fully in control, pushing his wrists - which seem to be made of high-tensile steel - right through the ball and sending a thunderous pull in front of square
flashed square on the off side

another boundary! Slightly slower cutter from Watson, and Morgan just eased into a cover drive, beating the field and getting enough timing to evade the cover sweeper as well. Superb shot, and Morgan is hurrying England's win here
drop and run into the off side, and that's Morgan's fifty, and a well-paced innings it is
very full, almost a yorker and Wright pushes it back to the bowler
full again, outside off and Wright drives to cover
doesn't make a difference, as Morgan flays an off drive to the boundary! He didn't look to have hit it that hard, but the timing was spot on and that's raced away!
very full, sliced behind square on the off side
short, Wright is in some discomfort as the ball hurries on to him but he manages to get something on it to pick up a single behind square on the leg side
wristy drive into the covers

gone! Will there be a twist here? Wright shuffled right across his stumps in trying to work the ball to leg and Harris speared one in full, fast and straight. The Australians went up as one as soon as the ball struck the pad, and the umpire agrees
he's off the mark straight away, working the ball of his hip out to deep midwicket. They think about a second, but the fielder charges in very quickly
full and landing on off stump, Bresnan drives to mid on
driven again, harder this time, but Watto flings himself down and to his left to pull off an impressive stop and negate the single

overthrows! Bresnan dropped the ball towards cover and they set off, Clarke swooped and fired a shy at the non-striker's end, the ball hit the stumps with Bresnan safely home and ricocheted towards the boundary, where Hauritz cut it off. All very amusing to the crowd
smashed! Morgan lifts one over a straight-ish long off, the ball bouncing just short of the boundary. Morgan isn't slowing down, despite the wicket
and then picks up the single into the covers, great batting
four more! Watson strays in line down the leg side and is neatly flicked to the fine leg boundary by Bresnan
good start, aimed at the stumps and Morgan drives to mid on

uppercut! Bollinger sent down a bouncer, wide of off. Morgan started to sway out of the way but then saw the width, throwing his bat out to lift the ball up and over the slip region to third man. It's those wrists again!
good comeback, jagging one in to Morgan, who pushes cautiously to mid on
straight again, Morgan tries to work the ball to leg but finds midwicket
squirts off the outer half towards backward point, where a slight misfield from Ponting lets them through for one
tip-and-run from Bresnan, who pushes a length ball on off stump to the off side and sets off immediately
nice shot from Bresnan, just opening the face and running the ball down fine of short third man. The two may have been on, but they decided not to take the risk
pushed defensively to cover, but too close to the fielder for a single
turn for Hauritz! Morgan went for an expansive sweep to leg, but the ball dipped and turned on him, beating the bat and striking him on the body
he stays deep in the crease this time and nurdles a single infront of square on the leg side
aggressive line from Hauritz, wide of off, and flighted too. Bresnan drives to mid off
tidy finish, tossed up outside off and Bresnan defends
pushed defensively to off
short, Morgan is hurried into a pull shot and the ball flies in the air at a very catchable speed and height, but straight of the man at midwicket and down to long on

tight! Morgan dropped the ball close in on the off side and they set off straight away, the fielder runs in and fires in a direct hit. Third umpire is called for... Not out! That was mighty close though
sharp delivery, back of a length on off stump and quick. Bresnan can't get it away, and Bollinger ambles down to give him a gentle word of encouragement...
dot ball again as Bollinger spears in a yorker on off stump
inside edge! But goes straight down onto his boot and rolls into the off side. No run taken
sweep from Morgan, who connects well to send the ball down to fine leg, but there's a fielder down there
this one turns in from off and keeps a little low, but Bresnan doesn't have too much trouble in sending it down to third man
well bowled! Hauritz flights one on middle and leg, the ball grips and turns and takes the edge, but down towards short third man
turn again, this one landed outside leg and lured Morgan into a sweep, but then turned across him to beat the bat and strike the pad
there's the one that goes straight on! But it's pitched outside leg, so Hauritz's appeal for lbw is quickly put down
pushed down to long off
for the third time Bollinger has gone right through a batsman! This one nipped in a touch to beat the inside edge of Morgan's pull and flew right over off stump
cross-seamed from Bollinger this time, and it just grips a touch and moves away to beat the outside edge of Morgan's defensive prod
half an appeal as ball strikes pad, but that was going well down and they take a leg bye
a touch of width given, and Bresnan sends the ball down to third man
beaten! This one leaps up off a length and flies past the edge of Morgan's bat! Bollinger is nonplussed, but Morgan doesn't give off any sign of being flustered. Great ball though
yep, Morgan put that last ball right out of his mind as he drives on the up through cover and times the ball superbly to grab another boundary
good from Hauritz, full, spinning a touch and Bresnan defends
that will do nicely for Bresnan, tickling it into the leg side to get Morgan back on strike
excellent stuff here from Morgan, picked a gap in front of square on the off side and timed his cut shot superbly for a boundary
follows it up with a nudge into the leg side to collect a single
bosh, good thumping drive to a floated delivery outside off finds a diving cover fielder which keeps it to one
Morgan keeps the strike, maybe not how he intended, it ran off an inside edge behind square of the leg side for one
and doesn't start well at all, slipped down the leg side, Morgan tickles it round the corner and it runs away for four
follows it up with a solid block into the covers to collect a single
Bresnan has done well here, not trying anything too fancy, and blocks this out watchfully
another easy single here, Bresnan didn't really time this well and it lolled to mid off for a quick single
Morgan on fire here, really top innings this, hint of width and Morgan cut superbly, just behind point and it raced away for another boundary
sees out the over with a careful defence
floated well up outside off, Hauritz really searching for a wicket, but Bresnan thumps it cleanly past extra cover for four more
Bresnan this time is defending watchfully into the off side
nicely bowled again and Bresnan defends
tossed up and a big heave from Bresnan, fetched it from well outside off but timed it excellently, gets four to midwicket
follows up the two boundaries with a little nudge into the leg side for a single
Morgan on the reverse-sweep, will he make his hundred? He times the shot excellently but picks out the fielder at point
good from Hopes, drifting it into Bresnan, who drops it into the off side and scampers through for a single to bring Morgan back on strike
perhaps Morgan is going to try and hit his way to a hundred, here he saunters down the wicket and swishes at thin air
better shot this time, worked round to square leg and he takes a couple
this time it's blocked into the covers and Morgan rushes through for a single, he's just one hit away now
Bresnan doing the right thing as far as Morgan is concerned, blocking into the off side
oops, Bresnan misreads the script and steals a single and the strike
good piece of fielding from Harris, and probably saved Morgan's chance of a hundred, it was punched back down the ground and Harris stuck a hand out to keep it to one
well, Morgan trying to reach his hundred in style, clears his front foot out the way and smites it through midwicket for four
oh! Almost had it there, he cut it firmly but straight to third man, Morgan moves to 99
good delivery brings an end to an excellent innings from Bresnan, full, swinging in, quick and crashed into the stumps, but Bresnan has really done his job there
gentle start for Yardy, full toss on leg stump, clipped down to fine leg for a single to bring Morgan back on strike
there it is! Eoin Morgan wins the game and makes his hundred! What an innings! Full ball crashed down the ground for four, Morgan screams as he brings up the landmark and punches the air
